A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
If you are one of the group claiming that this is the worst entry ever\, I invite you to re-watch the prequels (or did you even see them once?)\, especially TPM and AotC.  Both were horrible.  Yes\, I am old enough that I have seen all of the films in their original theatrical releases at the theater - make of that what you will.

Odd how everyone complained about Lucas\, and now many seem to think he would have done a better job.  Just because this film wasn't perfect doesn't make it horrible.  There were slow parts\, and some things certainly didn't make sense (why use a ground cannon?)\, but there was more character complexity than in any of the other films\, the source of the Force was basically re-reestablished as something mystical rather than something you could ask your doctor if you had come down with\, there was a change in direction rather than a reliance on the past\, and a chance to set up entirely new possibilities.  I welcome the possible shake-up that comes.

Again\, the film isn't perfect\, but many viewers are being unduly harsh because they haven't been spoon-fed the same old stuff that they're used to getting.
